programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Corrèze, the mountains of the Limousin We set our heading for the Corrèze, amidst the mountains of the Limousin region, and a hike to the Deiro waterfalls, a natural beauty spot where two mills bear witness to man's activities on the Millevaches Plateau. Farther south, we discover the exceptional railway heritage of the Rochers Noirs Viaduct. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Bergeracois
The Bergeracois, the region around Bergerac, opens its doors with Séverine who produces honey and walnuts. Muriel takes us on a guided visit of her vines, a wine estate dating back over 200 years. Yannick and Céline offer a chance to go forest bathing.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Dole, with or without an accent? Dole, in Jura, is the former capital of Franche-Comté. Dole or Dôle? Without an accent. Officially written as Dôle until the 1960s, people here tend to lengthen the "o" in words like vélo or photo, as we'll see in the programme... Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Choosing the right merguez sausage
If the merguez, a spicy sausage originally from North Africa, is made from lamb, sometimes from veal or from beef, in reality it's often made from beef and/or pork... Also on the programme: Isabelle Marquis analyses four new products, a plateful of weeds and all about cranberries.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Pyrénées-Orientales A little slice of Catalonia, between sea and mountain, the Pyrénées-Orientales shelter fortified towns and villages such as Villefranche-de-Conflent and Prats-de-Mollo-la-Preste. An excursion to discover the dramatic Côte Rocheuse, where the Pyrenees plunge into the Mediterranean, and notably Collioure, jewel of the coast, and the towering Pic du Canigou. Directed by: Gabrielle Dréan (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Dordogne, the art of Prehistory A programme entirely devoted to prehistory in the Dordogne and its Vézère Valley, a Unesco world heritage site since 1979 for its numerous and exceptional prehistoric sites. We discover the Cussac Cave, closed to both television cameras and the general public, and whose prehistoric engravings are quite simply spectacular. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays Bigouden
In the Pays Bigouden, Brittany, Lenny and Lucie present all the stages involved in their seaweed production, from collection to sale. Sara explains the phases in brewing beer, from hops to tasting. To end, we meet some of the bird-lovers helping birds to nest.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: America in Montbéliard! Montbéliard and the USA are two different lands yet closely links by the Franche-Comté origins of those who helped build America. In this special feature on the US in Montbéliard, the programme brings a touch of the New World to Doubs! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Cooking for zero waste
The peel and leaves from fruit and vegetables aren't just edible, they're delicious! Also on the programme: why you need to look after your microbiota and how to go about it. What to drink instead of coffee? And Moldovan pickled gherkins.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Le LACMA, Los Angeles Le musée d'Art du comté de Los Angeles, le LACMA, est le plus grand musée de l'Ouest américain. Dès la fin du XIXe siècle, les artistes américains venaient séjourner en France, passionnés par les courants cubistes ou d'art abstrait. Monet, Renoir, Cézanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Braque, Kandinsky furent leurs maîtres... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Present worldwide, Relais & Châteaux promotes the luxury hotel sector. Cooked upside down and eaten in situ: the Tatin pie, a mouthwatering mistake. The jewellery creator Annelise Michelson moves into design.. Wearing a tie. Akho: the brainchild of a designer launching an eco-responsible brand.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: The free life of a vegan nomad Joëlle, a vegan nomad, took the decision to abandon city life for the peace and quiet of the Rockies. Discussing her life with Julien, she sets out all the advantages of living in the great outdoors, surrounded by breathtaking scenery. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Twenty years of food marketing
What were the most memorable marketing trends of the last twenty years, and what's likely to come next? Should we only eat seasonal fruit and vegetables? Plus: testing oven gloves and all the secrets of the kebab.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: La tradition du cuir par les maîtres gantiers
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: #VF
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Périgord Noir Nestling in the south-eastern corner of the Dordogne, one of the most deliciously foodie regions of France, the Périgord Noir counts some of the country's most beautiful listed villages. Welcome to Sarlat-la-Canéda, Roque-Gageac, the prehistoric cave of Font-de-Gaume and Saint-Léon-sur-Vézère. Directed by: Vanessa Pontet (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Dordogne, the art of Prehistory A programme entirely devoted to prehistory in the Dordogne and its Vézère Valley, a Unesco world heritage site since 1979 for its numerous and exceptional prehistoric sites. We discover the Cussac Cave, closed to both television cameras and the general public, and whose prehistoric engravings are quite simply spectacular. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Louvre
Measuring some 700 metres, the Rue du Louvre runs from the Rue de Rivoli to the Sentier district, crossing the 1st and 2nd arrondissements. Three of the street's best-known buildings have been given a complete facelift: the Bourse du Commerce, the Samaritaine and the legendary Poste Centrale.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken lasagne
Classic lasagne with a new twist for this chicken lasagne recipe with cauliflower purée and creamy cheese sauce.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Yvonnick Jegat, defending natural oysters
In his "garden" in the Gulf of Morbihan, Yvonnick Jegat cultivates the art of the natural oyster. He uses only sea-born baby oysters, known as spat, that are then raised on the sandy seabed. Maison Jegat, founded in 1925, is a pioneer in the defence of traditional oyster farming.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Île de Java (Indonésie) Découverte du marché de Java. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: We head to the Army Museum for a strictly "defensive" visit. Furniture, rugs, objects: Alexia Leleu brings her family history to life. Balenciaga breaks all the rules, freeing fashion from its inhibitions. A journey through time with Les Vertugadins, a design studio creating period costumes. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Soupe au maïs et au jalapeno et pain au maïs
programme.desc: Sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and corn bread Sweetcorn forms the base for Kimberly Lallouz' recipes as she prepares a sweetcorn and jalapeno soup and a corn bread roll. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Amélie and Frédéric, Upper Laurentians Amélie, Frédéric and their two daughters felt they were suffocating in their home in Montréal. They moved to live on the banks of a river in the Upper Laurentians. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.sub-title: L'excellence des boiseries de la maison Féau
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Don Giovanni "Don Giovanni", the work that Richard Wagner considered to be "the opera of all operas"! Composed in 1787 by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, to a libretto by Lorenzo da Ponte. In 2019, it was staged and directed by Ivo Van Hove at the Palais Garnier, Paris... Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Basque Country Between the Pyrenees and the Atlantic Ocean, a voyage of discovery through the Basque Country, taking time out to explore Saint-Jean-de-Luz and Mauléon, capital of the espadrille. Saint-Jean-Pied-de-Port, obligatory for pilgrims en-route to Santiago de Compostela; in the southern Aldude Valley, Pays Quint is a Spanish enclave administered by France. Directed by: Isabelle Le Guen (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Dordogne, the art of Prehistory A programme entirely devoted to prehistory in the Dordogne and its Vézère Valley, a Unesco world heritage site since 1979 for its numerous and exceptional prehistoric sites. We discover the Cussac Cave, closed to both television cameras and the general public, and whose prehistoric engravings are quite simply spectacular. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
It's the season of babies! Louis' telephone hardly stops ringing... everyone thinks they have raccoons or squirrels in their walls or roof.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Quebec flavour for far away recipes The chefs Victor Soto, from the restaurant Tacos Victor, and Paul Toussaint, from the restaurant Kamùy, give recipes from other countries a distinctly Quebec twist. Fabien Cloutier and Johanne Despins have the pleasure of tasting these new culinary creations. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Natural wines
The market for natural wines is constantly growing... Farm-restaurants: a new trend? What's on the menu at a mi'kmaw wedding? Goji and açai berries, chia seeds, do all these so-called super foods really have miraculous properties?
Presented by: Johane Despins.
